<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[20, 10, 901, 42]]<|/det|>
## Ableitung der Anus-Funktion : (wichtig für Integration) 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[50, 50, 320, 122]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{align*}
\cdot f(x) &= \arc \sin x \\
f'(x) &= \frac{1}{\sqrt{1-x^2}}
\end{align*}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[500, 50, 780, 122]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{align*}
\cdot f(x) &= \arc \s \sin h x \\
f'(x) &= \frac{1}{\sqrt{1+x^2}}
\end{align*}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[50, 147, 325, 219]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{align*}
\cdot f(x) &= \arc \cos x \\
f'(x) &= -\frac{1}{\sqrt{1-x^2}}
\end{align*}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|> [[500, 147, 777, 219]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{align*}
\cdot f(x) &= \arc \c \cos h x \\
f'(x) &= \frac{1}{\sqrt{x^2-1}}
\end{align*}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[50, 243, 325, 315]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{align*}
\cdot f(x) &= \arc \tan x \\
f'(x) &= \frac{1}{1+x^2}
\end{align*}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[500, 243, 787, 315]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{align*}
\cdot f(x) &= \arc \t \tan h x \\
f'(x) &= \frac{1}{1-x^2}
\end{align*}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[50, 339, 325, 411]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{align*}
\cdot f(x) &= \arc \cot x \\
f'(x) &= -\frac{1}{1+x^2}
\end{align*}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[500.5, 339, 775, 411]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{align*}
\cdot f(x) &= \arc \c \cot h x \\
f'(x) &= \frac{1}{1-x^2}
\end{math}
\]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[20, 457, 576, 490]]<|/det|>
## Ableitung der Hyperbelfunktionen : 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[40, 497, 690, 741]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{align*}
&\rightarrow \text{exponentielle Schreibweise nutzen} \\
&\cdot \sin h(x) = \frac{e^x - e^{-x}}{2} \rightarrow \sin h'(x) = \cos h(x) \\
&\cdot \cos h(x) = \frac{e^x + e^{-x}}{2} \rightarrow \cos h'(x) = \sin h(x) \\
&\cdot \tan h(x) = \frac{\sinh(x)}{\cosh(x)} \rightarrow \tan h'(x) = 1 - \tanh^2(x) = \frac{1}{\cosh^2(x)} \\
&\cdot \coth(x) = \frac{\cosh(x)}{\sinh(x)} \rightarrow \coth'(x) = 1 - \coth^2(x) = -\frac{1}{\sinh^2(x)}
\end{align*}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[20, 765, 977, 970]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{align*}
\text{Bsp :} \quad \cdot f(x) &= \frac{1 + \cos x}{1 - \sin x} \\
f'(x) &= \frac{(-\sin x) \cdot (1 - \sin x) - (1 + \cos x) \cdot (-\cos x)}{(1 - \sin x)^2} \\
&= \frac{-\sin x + \sin^2 x + \cos x + \cos^2 x}{(1 - \sin x)^2} \quad \sin^2 x + \cos^2 x = 1 \\
&= \frac{1 - \sin x + \cos x}{(1 - \sin x)^2}
\end{align*}
\]
